verses.verse: And Ahab <S%H256><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> Jezebel <S%H348><s%> all that Elijah <S%H452><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%>, and withal how he had slain <S%H2026><s%> all the prophets <S%H5030><s%> with the sword <S%H2719><s%>.

Then Jezebel <S%H348><s%> send <S%H7971><s%> a messenger <S%H4397><s%> unto Elijah <S%H452><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, So let the gods <S%H430><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> to me <S%H3254><s%>, and more also <S%H7760><s%>, if I make not thy life <S%H5315><s%> as the life <S%H5315><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> of them by to-morrow <S%H4279><s%> about this time <S%H6256><s%>.

And when he saw <S%H7200><s%> that <S%H6965><s%>, he arose, and went <S%H3212><s%> for his life <S%H5315><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> to Beer-sheba <S%H884><s%>, which belongeth to Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and left <S%H3240><s%> his servant there <S%H5288><s%>.

But he himself went <S%H1980><s%> a day <S%H3117><s%>'s journey <S%H1870><s%> into the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> and sat down <S%H3427><s%> under a <S%H259><s%> juniper-tree <S%H7574><s%>: and he requested <S%H7592><s%> for himself <S%H5315><s%> that he might die <S%H4191><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, It is enough <S%H7227><s%>; now <S%H3068><s%>, O Jehovah, take away <S%H3947><s%> my life <S%H5315><s%>; for I am not better <S%H2896><s%> than my fathers <S%H1><s%>.

And he lay <S%H7901><s%> down and slept <S%H3462><s%> under a <S%H259><s%> juniper-tree <S%H7574><s%>; and <S%H4397><s%>, behold, an angel touched <S%H5060><s%> him <S%H559><s%>, and said unto him <S%H6965><s%>, Arise and eat <S%H398><s%>.

And he looked <S%H5027><s%>, and <S%H4763><s%>, behold, there was at his head a cake <S%H5692><s%> baken on the coals <S%H7529><s%>, and a cruse <S%H6835><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>. And he did eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%>, and laid him down <S%H7901><s%> again <S%H7725><s%>.

And the angel <S%H4397><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> came again <S%H7725><s%> the second time <S%H8145><s%>, and touched <S%H5060><s%> him <S%H559><s%>, and said, Arise <S%H6965><s%> and eat <S%H398><s%>, because the journey <S%H1870><s%> is too great for thee <S%H7227><s%>.

And he arose <S%H6965><s%>, and did eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> in the strength <S%H3581><s%> of that food <S%H396><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> and forty <S%H705><s%> nights <S%H3915><s%> unto Horeb <S%H2722><s%> the mount <S%H2022><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>.

And he came <S%H935><s%> thither unto a cave <S%H4631><s%>, and lodged <S%H3885><s%> there <S%H1697><s%>; and, behold, the word of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> came to him <S%H559><s%>, and he said unto him <S%H452><s%>, What doest thou here, Elijah?

And he said <S%H559><s%>, I have been very <S%H7065><s%> jealous <S%H7065><s%> for Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>; for the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> have forsaken <S%H5800><s%> thy covenant <S%H1285><s%>, thrown down <S%H2040><s%> thine altars <S%H4196><s%>, and slain <S%H2026><s%> thy prophets <S%H5030><s%> with the sword <S%H2719><s%>: and I <S%H3498><s%>, even I only, am left; and they seek <S%H1245><s%> my life <S%H5315><s%>, to take it away <S%H3947><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Go forth <S%H3318><s%>, and stand <S%H5975><s%> upon the mount <S%H2022><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>. And <S%H3068><s%>, behold, Jehovah passed by <S%H5674><s%>, and a great <S%H1419><s%> and strong <S%H2389><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> rent <S%H6561><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, and brake in pieces <S%H7665><s%> the rocks <S%H5553><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; but Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> was not in the wind <S%H7307><s%>: and after <S%H310><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> an earthquake <S%H7494><s%>; but Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> was not in the earthquake <S%H7494><s%>:

and after <S%H310><s%> the earthquake <S%H7494><s%> a fire <S%H784><s%>; but Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> was not in the fire <S%H784><s%>: and after <S%H310><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> a still <S%H1827><s%> small <S%H1851><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%>.

And it was so <S%H452><s%>, when Elijah heard <S%H8085><s%> it <S%H3874><s%>, that he wrapped his face <S%H6440><s%> in his mantle <S%H155><s%>, and went out <S%H3318><s%>, and stood <S%H5975><s%> in <S%H6607><s%> the entrance of the cave <S%H4631><s%>. And <S%H6963><s%>, behold, there came a voice unto him <S%H559><s%>, and said, What doest thou here <S%H452><s%>, Elijah?

And he said <S%H559><s%>, I have been very <S%H7065><s%> jealous <S%H7065><s%> for Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>; for the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> have forsaken <S%H5800><s%> thy covenant <S%H1285><s%>, thrown down <S%H2040><s%> thine altars <S%H4196><s%>, and slain <S%H2026><s%> thy prophets <S%H5030><s%> with the sword <S%H2719><s%>; and I <S%H3498><s%>, even I only, am left; and they seek <S%H1245><s%> my life <S%H5315><s%>, to take it away <S%H3947><s%>.

And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3212><s%>, Go, return <S%H7725><s%> on thy way <S%H1870><s%> to the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Damascus <S%H1834><s%>: and when thou comest <S%H935><s%>, thou shalt anoint <S%H4886><s%> Hazael <S%H2371><s%> to be king <S%H4428><s%> over Syria <S%H758><s%>;

and Jehu <S%H3058><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Nimshi <S%H5250><s%> shalt thou anoint <S%H4886><s%> to be king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel <S%H3478><s%>; and Elisha <S%H477><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Shaphat <S%H8202><s%> of Abel-meholah <S%H65><s%> shalt thou anoint <S%H4886><s%> to be prophet in thy room <S%H5030><s%>.

And it shall come to pass <S%H4422><s%>, that him that escapeth from the sword <S%H2719><s%> of Hazael <S%H2371><s%> shall Jehu <S%H3058><s%> slay <S%H4191><s%>; and him that escapeth <S%H4422><s%> from the sword <S%H2719><s%> of Jehu <S%H3058><s%> shall Elisha <S%H477><s%> slay <S%H4191><s%>.

Yet will I leave <S%H7604><s%> me seven <S%H7651><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>, all the knees <S%H1290><s%> which have not bowed <S%H3766><s%> unto Baal <S%H1168><s%>, and every mouth <S%H6310><s%> which hath not kissed him <S%H5401><s%>.

So he departed <S%H3212><s%> thence <S%H4672><s%>, and found Elisha <S%H477><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Shaphat <S%H8202><s%>, who was plowing <S%H2790><s%>, with twelve <S%H8147><s%> yoke <S%H6776><s%> of oxen before <S%H6440><s%> him <S%H8147><s%>, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah <S%H452><s%> passed <S%H5674><s%> over unto him <S%H7993><s%>, and cast his mantle upon him <S%H155><s%>.

And he left <S%H5800><s%> the oxen <S%H1241><s%>, and ran <S%H7323><s%> after <S%H310><s%> Elijah <S%H452><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Let me <S%H5401><s%>, I pray thee, kiss my father <S%H1><s%> and my mother <S%H517><s%>, and then I will follow <S%H3212><s%> thee <S%H559><s%>. And he said unto him <S%H3212><s%>, Go back again <S%H7725><s%>; for what have I done to thee <S%H6213><s%>?

And he returned <S%H7725><s%> from following him <S%H310><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> the yoke <S%H6776><s%> of oxen <S%H1241><s%>, and slew <S%H2076><s%> them <S%H1310><s%>, and boiled their flesh <S%H1320><s%> with the instruments <S%H3627><s%> of the oxen <S%H1241><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> unto the people <S%H5971><s%>, and they did eat <S%H398><s%>. Then he arose <S%H6965><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> after <S%H310><s%> Elijah <S%H452><s%>, and ministered unto him <S%H8334><s%>.
